content: 7 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 row rs 3 - 11 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 repeat row 1 - 8 twice more 3 repeats total you should have 64 sts you will have three 5-stitch bobbles starting row 12 you will decrease you should have 13 sts every row and increase on even row like so 3 stitch bobbles row 12 k2 k2tog k to last st kfb row 1 k4 mb3 k to last 4 sts k2tog row 13 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 k2 row 14 k2 k2tog k to last st kfb row 2 4 6 k2 k2tog k to last st kfb row 3 5 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 row 15 k9 mb9 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 you should have 10 sts row 16 18 20 22 24 26 k2 k2tog k to last st kfb row 7 k4 mb3 k to last 4 sts k2tog row 17 19 21 23 25 k to last 4 sts k2 k2tog k2 you will have two 3-stitch bobbles this repeat row 15 - 26 twice more is your last bobble 3 repeats total you will have four more 9-stitch bobbles you should have 45 sts thispatternwascreatedbyjayedwardsandislicensedunderacreativecommonsattribution-noncommercial-sharealike4 0 internationallicense toviewacopyofthislicense visithttp //creativecommons org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4 0/orsendalettertocreative commons pobox1866 mountainview ca94042 usa sea witch scarf 4 of 4 finishing row 8 k2 k2tog k to last st kfb row 9 k to last 4 sts k2tog k2 repeat row 8 and 9 until 5 sts remain after an even ws row finish as follows r1 rs k1 k2tog k2 r2 ws k1 k2tog kfb r3 rs k1 k2tog k1 bind off weave in any tails before and during blocking press the centres of your bobbles inward to produce a sucker shape block to your desired measurements mine came out to about 76 in 193 cm long and 9 in 23 cm wide note for a shorter narrower scarf try using a lighter-weight yarn this scarf was made using dk weight yarn and after blocking came out to 60 inches long and 8 inches across acknowledgements special thanks to seanan mcguire who inspired this pattern in the first place the luidaeg remains my favourite to nasamuffin and alex katz who kindly helped ensure that it made sense outside of my own brain seriously they made it so much better to noor e bjørneboe and knittingphysicist who proofread before publishing to everyone in the discord who encouraged me to put it out into the world y all are so wonderful i cannot thank you enough thispatternwascreatedbyjayedwardsandislicensedunderacreativecommonsattribution-noncommercial-sharealike4 0 internationallicense toviewacopyofthislicense visithttp //creativecommons org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4 0/orsendalettertocreative commons pobox1866 mountainview ca94042 usa
